leadsConversions.title: Leads & Conversions

systemPrompts.question: How do I view and edit system prompts for clients?
systemPrompts.answer: System prompts are accessible through the Admin Console System Prompts tab. Each client has a customizable system prompt that defines AI behavior, conversation flow, and business rules. The system prompt reader provides organized sections with search, copy, and editing capabilities.
systemPrompts.step1: Navigate to Admin Console ‚Üí System Prompts tab
systemPrompts.step2: Select a client from the dropdown to view their system prompt
systemPrompts.step3: Use the collapsible interface: expand/collapse entire prompt or individual sections
systemPrompts.step4: Search within sections using the search bar at the top
systemPrompts.step5: Copy specific sections using the copy button next to each section
systemPrompts.step6: Edit system prompt by clicking "Edit System Prompt" button
systemPrompts.step7: Changes propagate immediately to the site database for live AI behavior
systemPrompts.step8: Use "Expand All" / "Collapse All" buttons to manage section visibility

systemPromptSections.question: What sections are available in the system prompt reader?
systemPromptSections.answer: The system prompt reader organizes content into logical sections with icons and collapsible interface. Each section can be expanded, collapsed, searched, and copied independently. The interface supports both English and Hebrew with proper RTL layout.
systemPromptSections.step1: ü§ñ Role & Identity: Defines the AI assistant's personality and core identity
systemPromptSections.step2: üéØ Primary Goal: Main objectives and success criteria for conversations
systemPromptSections.step3: üìä Current User State: Context about the current conversation state
systemPromptSections.step4: üí¨ State-Aware Communication: Rules for contextual conversation flow
systemPromptSections.step5: ‚úÖ BANT Qualification Process: Lead qualification methodology and criteria
systemPromptSections.step6: üìÖ Meeting Scheduling Protocol: Calendly integration and meeting booking rules
systemPromptSections.step7: üö® Smart Escalation Triggers: When to escalate to human agents
systemPromptSections.step8: üè¢ Project Details: Specific project information and context
systemPromptSections.step9: üìã JSON Output Requirements: Structured data format specifications

systemPromptRTL.question: How does RTL (Hebrew) support work in the system prompt reader?
systemPromptRTL.answer: The system prompt reader provides complete RTL support for Hebrew interface elements while preserving the original system prompt text formatting. UI controls, navigation, and layout adapt to Hebrew direction, but system prompt content remains in its original language for AI consistency.
systemPromptRTL.step1: Switch to Hebrew using the language toggle (üåê) in the navigation
systemPromptRTL.step2: Interface elements automatically adjust to right-to-left layout
systemPromptRTL.step3: Buttons, search bar, and controls move to RTL positions
systemPromptRTL.step4: Section headers and navigation text appear in Hebrew
systemPromptRTL.step5: System prompt content remains in original language (usually English)
systemPromptRTL.step6: Copy and edit functions work seamlessly in both languages
systemPromptRTL.step7: Collapsible sections maintain proper RTL spacing and alignment
systemPromptRTL.step8: Toast notifications and confirmations appear in Hebrew

unauthorized.title: Unauthorized Access
unauthorized.message: You don't have permission to access this resource. Please log in or contact your administrator.
unauthorized.details: This page requires valid authentication credentials. Your session may have expired.
unauthorized.help: If you believe this is an error, please contact support or try logging in again.

badRequest.title: Bad Request
badRequest.message: The request couldn't be processed due to invalid parameters or malformed data.
badRequest.details: The server couldn't understand the request due to invalid syntax or missing required parameters.
badRequest.help: If this problem persists, please contact support with the error details.

forbidden.title: Access Forbidden
forbidden.message: You don't have sufficient permissions to access this resource.
forbidden.details: Your current role doesn't grant access to this resource. Contact your administrator if you need access.
forbidden.help: If you believe you should have access to this resource, please contact your administrator.

internalServerError.title: Internal Server Error
internalServerError.message: Something went wrong on our servers. We're working to fix this issue.
internalServerError.details: An unexpected error occurred while processing your request. Our technical team has been notified.
internalServerError.help: If this problem continues, please contact our support team with the error details.

serviceUnavailable.title: Service Unavailable
serviceUnavailable.message: The service is temporarily unavailable. We're performing maintenance to improve your experience.
serviceUnavailable.details: Our system is currently undergoing scheduled maintenance. This should only take a few minutes.
serviceUnavailable.help: Thank you for your patience. The service will be restored shortly.

alternative.title: Oops! You're off the map
alternative.message: The page you're looking for seems to have wandered off. Don't worry, let's get you back on track!
alternative.searchHint: Try searching for leads, reports, or specific features
alternative.helpMessage: The URL you entered might be mistyped, or the page might have been moved or deleted.

faq.title: Help & Support Center
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions and learn how to make the most of CRM Demo

firstLogin.question: How do I log in for the first time?
firstLogin.answer: Go to the login page, enter your email and password. You can also use Google or Facebook authentication. If you don't have an account, click "Sign Up" to create one.
firstLogin.step3: Click "Sign In" or choose social login

dashboard.question: How do I navigate the dashboard?
dashboard.answer: The dashboard is your central hub. Use the sidebar to navigate between sections: Leads, Messages, Calendar, Reports, and Settings. The main area shows widgets with real-time metrics.
dashboard.step1: Familiarize yourself with the sidebar navigation
dashboard.step2: Explore the dashboard widgets and metrics
dashboard.step3: Use the global search in the top bar

whatsapp.question: How does WhatsApp integration work?
whatsapp.answer: CRM Demo connects to WhatsApp Business API for automated messaging. Set up templates, configure automated responses, and manage conversations directly from the Messages section.
whatsapp.step4: Start conversations from the Messages page

scoring.question: What is BANT/HEAT lead scoring?
scoring.answer: BANT (Budget, Authority, Need, Timeline) and HEAT (Hot, Warm, Cold, Burning) are qualification systems. BANT scores lead quality based on decision criteria, while HEAT tracks engagement temperature.
scoring.step1: View lead scores in the Leads section
scoring.step4: Use scoring for prioritization and filtering

management.question: How do I add and manage leads?
management.answer: Navigate to the Leads section to add, edit, and manage your leads. You can import leads via CSV, add manually, or they'll be created automatically from WhatsApp conversations.
management.step1: Go to the Leads page from the sidebar
management.step2: Click "Add New Lead" or import CSV
management.step3: Fill in contact information and qualification

filtering.question: How do I filter and search leads?
filtering.answer: Use the search bar and filters in the Leads section. Filter by status, temperature, project, source, or BANT/HEAT scores. Save frequent filter combinations for quick access.
filtering.step1: Use the search bar for quick text search
filtering.step2: Apply filters using the filter dropdown
filtering.step3: Combine multiple filters for precise results

conversations.question: How do I manage WhatsApp conversations?
conversations.answer: The Messages section shows all WhatsApp conversations. Click on any conversation to view message history, send replies, and schedule meetings directly from the chat interface.
conversations.step2: Select a conversation from the list
conversations.step3: Review message history and lead context

templates.question: How do I create and use message templates?
templates.answer: Create reusable message templates in the Templates section. Templates can include variables for personalization and can be used for automated responses or quick manual sending.
templates.step1: Go to Templates from the sidebar
templates.step3: Write your message with variables like {name}

dashboard.question: How do I read the analytics dashboard?
dashboard.answer: The analytics dashboard shows key metrics like conversion rates, response times, and lead progression. Use the Messages Analytics page for detailed message performance and the Reports page for comprehensive analysis.
dashboard.step2: Visit Messages Analytics for detailed metrics
dashboard.step3: Generate reports from the Reports page

export.question: How do I export reports and data?
export.answer: Most sections have export functionality. Use the "Export" buttons to download data as CSV or PDF. Reports can be generated with custom date ranges and filters.
export.step1: Go to the section you want to export

scheduling.question: How do I schedule meetings with leads?
scheduling.answer: Use the Calendar page or schedule directly from message conversations. Integration with Calendly allows leads to book meetings automatically. View all scheduled meetings in the Calendar section.
scheduling.step1: Go to Calendar page or message conversation
scheduling.step3: Choose date/time or share Calendly link
scheduling.step4: Confirm meeting details and send invitation

calendly.question: How do I set up Calendly integration?
calendly.answer: Connect your Calendly account in Settings ‚Üí Integrations. Once connected, you can share booking links directly from conversations and track meeting analytics.
calendly.step3: Authorize CRM Demo access to your Calendly
calendly.step4: Configure default meeting types and settings

mobile.question: Can I use CRM Demo on mobile devices?
mobile.answer: Yes! CRM Demo is fully responsive and optimized for mobile use. Access all features from your smartphone or tablet browser. The interface automatically adapts to your screen size.
mobile.step2: Navigate to your CRM Demo URL

language.question: How do I change the language?
language.answer: Use the language toggle in the top navigation bar to switch between English and Hebrew. The interface supports right-to-left (RTL) layout for Hebrew and other RTL languages.
language.step1: Look for the language toggle (üåê) in the top bar
language.step4: Setting is saved for future sessions

templates.title: Message Template Management
templates.subtitle: Manage your message templates with drag & drop. Choose 1-3 active templates from your template bank.
templates.overLimitGuide: You have more than 3 active templates. For optimal performance, consider moving some to Template Bank.
templates.templateGuideDescription: Drag templates from your Template Bank to Active Templates (max 3). These will be used as your message hooks. Click any template to edit content and targeting.
